item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

summary.text:
Commends: (1) the peaceful conduct of the June 2010 referendum and hopes that the new constitutional order will promote greater democracy in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan; and (2) the government of Uzbekistan for cooperating with the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, the International Committee of the Red Cross, the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF), and other international nongovernmental organizations in meeting the needs of ethnic Uzbek refugees who fled Kyrgyzstan.

Regrets the loss of life in the recent ethnic uprisings and expresses concern for the welfare of those displaced.

Encourages the development of ties between members of the House of Representatives and the Senate with members of the Parliament of Kyrgyzstan.

Calls upon the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe to take an active role in assisting the government of Kyrgyzstan.

Expresses the sense of the House of Representatives concerning steps to be taken by the government of Kyrgyzstan to restore order, provide for transparent parliamentary elections, and address political, social, ethnic, and economic tensions.

bill.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives regarding the situation in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan.

item.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives regarding the situation in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
